subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
Either from: 
*{{inh|zh|sit-pro|*s-gaŋ||hill, ridge, mountain}} (STEDT), cognate with {{och-l|岡|hill, crest}}, {{och-l|[[鯨]]|whale}}, {{cog|bo|tr=sgang}}, {{cog|my|tr=khaŋ|t=hill, knoll}}, {{cog|my|tr=khoŋ|t=summit}}, {{cog|lhu|qhɔ³³||mountain}}, {{cog|suv|gɹaŋ³³||mountain}}, Proto-{{w|Tamangic languages|Tamangic}} *''ᴬgaŋ'' ("hill, mountain"); or 
*of {{der|zh|aav}} origin, compare {{cog|mkh-pro|*graŋ||hill, peak}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}), whence {{cog|mnw|tr=krɛ̀aŋ|t=peak}} and {{cog|mkh-okm|grāṅ||hill on flat land}}.
